text: Charles Dow Clark (September 21, 1869 – March 26, 1959) was an actor and an American football coach and referee. He served as the head football coach at the University of Mississippi while taking a leave from his studies at Tufts College in Medford, Massachusetts. Clark became an actor, appearing in such films as The Bat Whispers (1925) and It Happened in Hollywood (1937). ==References== ==External links== * Category:1869 births Category:1959 deaths Category:American film actors Category:Ole Miss Rebels football coaches Category:Tufts Jumbos football coaches Category:Tufts University alumni Category:People from St. Albans, Vermont
title: Charles Dow Clark
